units.title: Histo4i multiplexed immunofluorescence imaging protocol
units.text: To achieve multiplexing, we aligned images across all cycles, allowing simultaneous display of any protein stain (Supplementary Figs. 1c–f and 2a,b). In our experimental design, we interspersed unstained cycles to subtract cycle-specific backgrounds,
units.rationale: Describes the core imaging protocol for multiplexed staining with cycle alignment and background subtraction.

units.title: Tissue section staining and acquisition workflow
units.rationale: Captures the procedural sequence for staining and image acquisition in a high-throughput format.

units.title: Antibody elution and image registration
units.text:
Elute antibodies - Register
Segment nuclei
-Denoise
Label transfer was predicted based on correlation of RNA and protein features in sequenced cells and imaged nuclei, respectively.
units.rationale: Key actionable steps in the iterative Histo4i protocol for antibody removal and image alignment across cycles.

units.title: Oriented laminar window analysis
units.text: laminar windows measure 16.25 × 1.625 μm and are oriented on the tissue contour by maximizing the Euclidean distance transform of the masked organoid for each window.
units.rationale: Details the geometric and computational method for defining spatial analysis windows along tissue layers.

units.title: UMAP embedding for spatial cell type visualization
units.text:
visualized relationships within and across clusters using a UMAP embedding (Supplementary Fig. 5a–c).
The metacells were integrated using cluster similarity spectrum (CSS)30, and the integrated data were visualized using a UMAP embedding (Fig. 3c).
units.rationale: Specifies the dimensionality reduction method used to visualize spatial cell type relationships.

units.title: Spatial protein expression analysis within MTUs
units.text: average protein expression within each MTU highlight how each protein stain associates with each MTU (Supplementary Fig. 4a).
units.rationale: Captures the analytical goal of mapping protein signals to spatially defined micro-tissue units.

units.title: Timecourse analysis of MTU and nuclei organization
units.text: Over the timecourse and in the adult primary tissue, we also observed striking progression of MTU and nuclei organization patterns, further showcasing the robustness of the methods and the scale-cross
units.rationale: Describes the longitudinal analytical approach for tracking structural development across timepoints.
